reference.title: Exporting a document in external format with a path

section.indexterm: exportingdocuments in external format with path
documentexporting in external format with path
section.p: You can export a document in external format with its entire path information. You use this format to distribute a translated document for checking, for example, using the relative path information of the document to build the fully qualified name for the document to be exported.

section.title: Calling sequence
section.p: To export a document in external format, select External Format with relative path from Export as.

The External Format with relative path page is displayed (see ). windowsExport Documents (External format with path information) Export Documents window (External format with path information)Figure shows Export Documents window (External format with path information)

section.title: Options and parameters
section.p: The page displayed differs from the External page in only one field, Start path instead of Path. The following sections describe only this field. For an explanation of all other fields, refer to .

plentry.pd: Type the path name on the selected drive where you want the translated or original document to be stored. Use a trailing backslash (\). The path that you specify in this field will also be stored as part of its name. For example, if the document name is vers\docs\device.html and the start path is \target\, the document is exported under \target\vers\docs\device.html.

section.title: Results
section.p: The document is exported in external format under its name and path information and stored as an HTML file in the directory under the file name you specified. The document can then be further processed with the corresponding word-processing system.

If the path that you specified does not exist yet, you are asked whether you want to create the new path. If you are exporting one document, click Yes. If you are exporting several documents and the path is to apply to all documents, click Yes to All.
